item.title: Dissertation
item.description: © 2025, Chuyu Tian The aim of my dissertation is to investigate the justificatory status of rules in Aristotle’s ethics. How does Aristotle’s ethics differ from a rule-based one? In my dissertation, I clarify the meta-ethical status of ethical judgments and investigate the foundation of Aristotle’s ethics. In Chapter One, I propose a person-centric account of virtue and virtuous action. I argue that although Aristotle’s ethics involves rules, it differs fundamentally from rule-based ethics by beginning with the human being: the notion of the good person is necessary in defining virtue and action in accordance with virtue.
